description: An open vowel like 'a' in English 'father'.
Like 'e' in English 'net'.
Like 'ee' in English 'see'.
Like 'o' in English 'port'. Lips are rounded.
Like 'oo' in English 'moon'. Lips are tightly rounded.
No English equivalent. Say 'oo' but without rounding lips, tongue pulled back. Like the 'i' in 'ill' but further back.
Hard 'p', like English 'p' but with less air.
Hard 'b', like English 'b'.
Hard 't', tongue tip against the top teeth.
Hard 'd', tongue tip against the top teeth.
Hard 'k', like English 'k'.
Hard 'g', like English 'g' in 'go'.
Hard 'f', like English 'f'.
Hard 'v', like English 'v'.
Hard 's', like English 's' in 'sun'.
Hard 'z', like English 'z' in 'zoo'.
Hard 'sh' (ш). Like English 'sh' but with the tongue tip further back and slightly raised.
Hard 'zh' (ж). Like the 's' in 'treasure', but with the tongue tip further back.
Hard 'm', like English 'm'.
Hard 'n', like English 'n'.
Hard 'l' (dark l). The back of the tongue is raised. No direct English equivalent.
Hard 'r'. A rolled/trilled 'r' with the tongue tip.
The 'ts' sound (ц), like 'ts' in English 'cats'.
Soft 'p'. Press the middle of your tongue to the roof of your mouth while saying 'p'.
Soft 'b'. Press the middle of your tongue to the roof of your mouth while saying 'b'.
Soft 't'. It sounds almost like 'ts'."
Soft 'd'. It sounds almost like 'dz'.
Soft 'k', only occurs before [i] or [e].
Soft 'g', only occurs before [i] or [e].
Soft 'f'. A 'f' with a slight 'y' sound after it.
Soft 'v'. A 'v' with a slight 'y' sound after it.
Soft 's'. A hissing sound with the middle of the tongue raised.
Soft 'z'. A buzzing sound with the middle of the tongue raised.
Soft 'm'. Like saying 'm' and 'y' at the same time.
Soft 'n'. Like saying 'n' and 'y' at the same time.
Soft 'l' (light l). Like the 'l' in English 'leaf'.
Soft 'r'. A rolled 'r' with the middle of the tongue raised.
Always soft 'ch' (ч). Like a softer version of English 'church'.
Always soft, long 'sh' (щ). A long, hissing 'sh' with the middle of the tongue high.
The 'y' sound (й), like in English 'yes'.
